nodes.text: Olovin was a Galactic Alliance Immobilizer 418 cruiser, produced by Sienar Fleet Systems, that accompanied General Wedge Antilles on a feint in the Duro system during the Yuuzhan Vong War. Olovin helped trap the Yuuzhan Vong forces near the planet Duro with its gravity well projectors, which allowed the Galactic Alliance to take the planet Fondor with little resistance.
Produced by Sienar Fleet Systems, Olovin was an Immobilizer 418 cruiser equipped with gravity well generators.

During the later stages of the Yuuzhan Vong War, in which the extra-galactic Yuuzhan Vong invaded the galaxy, Olovin was assigned to the Galactic Alliance's General Wedge Antilles, who commanded the Star Destroyer Mon Mothma. In 29 ABY,

Olovin and other Galactic Alliance warships accompanied Antilles and Mon Mothma to the Duro system, where they engaged the Yuuzhan Vong fleet elements stationed there in a feint. After the Galactic Alliance forces had fought for a day near the planet Duro, and after Yuuzhan Vong reinforcements had arrived from the Yuuzhan Vong–held world of Fondor, Olovin, along with Mon Mothma and the fellow Immobilizer 418 cruiser Memory of Ithor, activated its gravity well generators. The positioning of the trio of interdicting ships prevented the Yuuzhan Vong forces, which were arrayed around Duro, from leaving the star system as long as the interdictor line held. With the Yuuzhan Vong forces stuck at Duro, General Garm Bel Iblis was able to lead a Galactic Alliance force to victory over the minimal Yuuzhan Vong guard the invaders had left at Fondor and its shipyards.

Olovin appeared in 2003's The Final Prophecy, written by Greg Keyes as a part of The New Jedi Order series of novels. The interdictor later received an entry in The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia, released in 2008, which confirmed its ship class.
